macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks Plunge as Major Indices Fall 1.34%-2.03%
items.summary: U.S. stocks experienced a broad sell-off with the S&P 500 dropping 1.57%, Nasdaq Composite falling 2.03%, and Dow Jones Industrial Average declining 1.34%, driven by recalibrated interest rate expectations and macroeconomic data.

items.title: Shock January US Jobs Data Adds 130,000 Jobs, Shifts Rate Cut Bets
items.summary: The US Labor Department reported a surge of 130,000 jobs in January, exceeding forecasts and prompting investors to adjust expectations for interest rate cuts amid a stable global economy.

items.title: Asian Markets Rally: Nikkei Surges Past 58,000, Kospi Up 2.5%
items.summary: Asian stocks mostly rallied following strong US jobs data, with Tokyo's Nikkei 225 breaking 58,000 on policy optimism after Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's victory and South Korea's Kospi rising 2.5% led by tech stocks.

items.title: Wall Street Mixed Ahead of Sell-Off: Robinhood Dips 8.8%, Exxon Rises 2.6%
items.summary: Wall Street showed mixed performance with S&P 500 and Nasdaq dipping slightly; Robinhood fell 8.8% on lower crypto volumes, Moderna slid 3.5% after flu vaccine rejection, while Exxon Mobil gained 2.6% and Kraft Heinz recovered 0.4% on split plan pause.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto Stocks Slide Amid Wall Street Selloff Ahead of Inflation Data
items.summary: Crypto-related stocks like Coinbase (down 7.9%) and Robinhood (down 8.79%) fell sharply as U.S. equities dropped, with Bitcoin trading around $66,000, down 2% in the past 24 hours. Markets await Friday's CPI report, which could impact risk assets including cryptocurrencies.

items.title: Coinbase Reports Surprise Q4 Loss Amid Crypto Selloff But Sees Dip Buying
items.summary: Coinbase swung to a quarterly loss due to a crypto exodus, with Bitcoin down 25% year-to-date, but the company remains optimistic about trading expansion including prediction markets and clearer regulations. Its stock bounced off a two-year low in extended trading.

items.title: Bitcoin Drags Down Broader Crypto Market with High Correlations
items.summary: Bitcoin is down 26% since January 1, 2025, pulling other cryptocurrencies like Ethereum and Cardano lower due to strong price correlations ranging from 0.6 to 0.8 with BTC. Crypto assets amplify U.S. stock market movements, especially tech selloffs.

items.title: Starknet Hosts Bitcoin Liquidity Talk with Atomiq Labs
items.summary: Starknet's 'Bitcoin Beyond L1' Founder Series features a session on swapping native BTC to Starknet, Solana, and other L2s, highlighting ongoing blockchain interoperability developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Canada Identifies Data Supply Chains as Missing Link in AI Strategy
items.summary: A February 12, 2026 report from the C.D. Howe Institute highlights that despite billions invested in AI talent and infrastructure, Canada lacks strong data supply chains, risking slowed innovation due to fragmented data access frameworks.[6]

items.title: ACM Announces CAIS 2026 Conference on AI and Agentic Systems
items.summary: The ACM has launched CAIS 2026, set for May 26–29 in San Jose, focusing on engineering compound AI systems, including multi-agent architectures, optimization, and evaluation for real-world reliability.[2]

items.title: Sandia Labs Advances AI Integration for Mission-Critical Work
items.summary: Sandia National Laboratories is investing in AI tools like SandiaAI Chat and collaborations with OpenAI, exploring federated training and RAG to transform science and security workflows.[3]

items.title: Mission Institutions Pilot AI Projects Across Public Services
items.summary: Mission RCMP, Memorial Hospital, city, and school district in Canada are piloting AI for tasks including generative applications, as reported on February 12, 2026.[8]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: PlayStation State of Play February 2026 Reveals Over 30 Games Including Sequels and Remakes
items.summary: Sony's State of Play on February 12 announced major titles like Kena: Scars of Kosmora sequel for PS5/PC in 2026, Ghost of Yōtei Legends release date trailer with multiplayer next month, Marathon server slam on February 26 and full release March 5, plus new games like Project Windless, Rev. Noir, John Wick adaptation, God of War trilogy remake, and Metal Gear Solid Master Collection 2.[1][2][3]
items.source: Game Informer, Video Games Chronicle, GameSpot YouTube

items.title: Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition Launches February 13
items.summary: Ubisoft releases Rayman: 30th Anniversary Edition on February 13 for PS5, Xbox Series X|S, Switch, and PC, featuring five versions of the 1995 classic, a never-before-playable SNES prototype, 120 bonus levels, enhanced features like rewind, and an exclusive interactive documentary with developer interviews.[5]

items.title: Kena: Bridge of Spirits Sequel Kena: Scars of Kosmora Announced
items.summary: Ember Lab revealed Kena: Scars of Kosmora, a sequel to Kena: Bridge of Spirits, set for 2026 on PS5 and PC, featuring an older Kena as a spirit guide with new staff weapon, evolving spirit companion mount, deeper combat, and larger world.[1][2][3]

items.title: Krafton Announces Project Windless Based on The Bird That Drinks Tears Novel
items.summary: Krafton revealed Project Windless, a PS5 adaptation of Korean novel The Bird That Drinks Tears about a rooster wielding twin blades against zealot armies; release date TBA.[1][2]

items.title: Konami Reveals Rev. Noir Action RPG and Darwin’s Paradox
items.summary: Konami announced Rev. Noir, a PS5 action RPG emphasizing heartfelt JRPG moments (TBA release), and Darwin’s Paradox, an octopus-themed game releasing April 2 with a demo on February 13.[1][2]

items.title: Untitled John Wick Game and Marathon Updates from State of Play
items.summary: A new untitled John Wick game was announced for PS5, Xbox Series X/S, PC (TBA); Marathon showed a horror-themed trailer, server slam February 26, and full release March 5 on PS5, Xbox, PC.[1][2][3]
items.source: Game Informer, Video Games Chronicle, GameSpot YouTube

items.title: PlayStation Plus Adds Marvel's Spider-Man 2 on February 17
items.summary: Marvel's Spider-Man 2 joins PlayStation Plus on February 17, with classics catalog expanding to include Tekken: Dark Resurrection and Time Crisis.[1][2]

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Fujitsu Announces Showcase of Quantum Computing and Arm-Based Processor at India AI Impact Summit
items.summary: Fujitsu will present its FUJITSU-MONAKA next-generation Arm-based processor and a quantum computer mock-up at the AI Impact Expo 2026 in New Delhi, highlighting fusion of computing technologies. CEO Takahito Tokita will deliver a keynote on February 20.

items.title: Ricoh Acquires Chilean Firm ValueTech to Boost Process Automation Capabilities
items.summary: Ricoh Chile S.A. has acquired ValueTech, a leader in digitalization and automation for processes and document management, to enhance its offerings in Latin America. The move supports Ricoh's global strategy for intelligent workplaces in regulated industries.

items.title: Samsung Claims Leadership in Supplying AI Chips to Nvidia
items.summary: Samsung asserts it leads the race to ship AI chips to Nvidia, amid ongoing competition in the semiconductor supply chain. This development was highlighted in market discussions on Asia tech performance.

items.title: Kioxia Extends Top Stock Performance Driven by Chipmaking Investments
items.summary: Kioxia continues as the world's top-performing stock in the sector, fueled by investments in chipmaking facilities and positive market outlook. The company benefits from broader semiconductor trends.
